YAHOO.widget.DateMath.name: YAHOO.widget.DateMath

return.description: true if the date overlaps two different years.

params.name: weekBeginDate
params.description: The JavaScript Date representing the first day of the week.

isYearOverlapWeek.description: Determines if a given week overlaps two different years.

return.description: The week number of the given date.

params.name: date
params.description: The JavaScript date for which to find the week number

params.name: calendarYear
params.description:
OPTIONAL - The calendar year to use for determining the week number. Default is
the calendar year of parameter "date".

params.name: weekStartsOn
params.description: OPTIONAL - The integer (0-6) representing which day a week begins on. Default is 0 (for Sunday).

getWeekNumber.description:
Calculates the week number for the given date. This function assumes that week 1 is the
week in which January 1 appears, regardless of whether the week consists of a full 7 days.
The calendar year can be specified to help find what a the week number would be for a given
date if the date overlaps years. For instance, a week may be considered week 1 of 2005, or
week 53 of 2004. Specifying the optional calendarYear allows one to make this distinction
easily.

return.description: The number of days since January 1 of the given year

params.name: date
params.description: The JavaScript date for which to find the offset

params.name: calendarYear
params.description: The calendar year to use for determining the offset

getDayOffset.description:
Calculates the number of days the specified date is from January 1 of the specified calendar year.
Passing January 1 to this function would return an offset value of zero.

return.description: The JavaScript Date representing the last day of the month

params.name: date
params.description: The JavaScript Date used to calculate the month end

findMonthEnd.description: Gets the last day of a month containing a given date.

return.description: true if the date occurs after the compared date; false if not.

params.name: date
params.description: The Date object to compare with the compare argument

params.name: compareTo
params.description: The Date object to use for the comparison

after.description: Determines whether a given date is after another date on the calendar.

return.description: The JavaScript Date cleared of all time fields

params.name: date
params.description: The JavaScript Date for which the time fields will be cleared

clearTime.description: Clears the time fields from a given date, effectively setting the time to midnight.

return.description: true if the date overlaps two different months.

params.name: weekBeginDate
params.description: The JavaScript Date representing the first day of the week.

isMonthOverlapWeek.description: Determines if a given week overlaps two different months.

return.description: The resulting Date object

params.description: The calendar year for which to retrieve January 1

getJan1.description: Retrieves a JavaScript Date object representing January 1 of any given year.

before.description: Determines whether a given date is before another date on the calendar.

ONE_DAY_MS.description: Constant field representing one day, in milliseconds

YAHOO.widget.DateMath.description:
YAHOO.widget.DateMath is used for simple date manipulation. The class is a static utility
used for adding, subtracting, and comparing dates.

YAHOO.widget.CalendarGroup.name: YAHOO.widget.CalendarGroup

SHOW_WEEKDAYS.description: True if the Calendar should show weekday labels. True by default.

MDY_DAY_POSITION.description: The position of the day in a month/day/year date string

MY_MONTH_POSITION.description: The position of the month in a month/year date string

MONTHS_SHORT.description: The short month labels for the current locale.

MULTI_SELECT.description: True if the Calendar should allow multiple selections. False by default.

DATE_FIELD_DELIMITER.description: The value used to delimit date fields in a date string passed to various Calendar functions.

MY_YEAR_POSITION.description: The position of the year in a month/year date string

close.description: Whether or not a close button should be displayed for this CalendarGroup

MONTHS_LONG.description: The long month labels for the current locale.

WEEKDAYS_MEDIUM.description: The medium weekday labels for the current locale.

LOCALE_WEEKDAYS.description: The setting that determines which length of weekday labels should be used. Possible values are "1char", "short", "medium", and "long".

DATE_RANGE_DELIMITER.description: The value used to delimit date ranges in a date string passed to various Calendar functions.

SHOW_WEEK_HEADER.description: True if the Calendar should show week row headers. False by default.

title.description: The title to display above the CalendarGroup's month header

maxdate.description: The maximum selectable date in the current Calendar (mm/dd/yyyy)

selected.description: The date or range of dates representing the current Calendar selection

pages.description: The number of pages to include in the CalendarGroup. This value can only be set once, in the CalendarGroup's constructor arguments.

NAV_ARROW_RIGHT.description: The image that should be used for the left navigation arrow.

HIDE_BLANK_WEEKS.description: True if the Calendar should suppress weeks that are not a part of the current month. False by default.

mindate.description: The minimum selectable date in the current Calendar (mm/dd/yyyy)

START_WEEKDAY.description: The weekday the week begins on. Default is 0 (Sunday).

SHOW_WEEK_FOOTER.description: True if the Calendar should show week row footers. False by default.

MDY_YEAR_POSITION.description: The position of the year in a month/day/year date string

WEEKDAYS_LONG.description: The long weekday labels for the current locale.

MDY_MONTH_POSITION.description: The position of the month in a month/day/year date string

pagedate.description: The month/year representing the current visible Calendar date (mm/yyyy)

MD_DAY_POSITION.description: The position of the day in a month/year date string

NAV_ARROW_LEFT.description: The image that should be used for the left navigation arrow.

MD_MONTH_POSITION.description: The position of the month in a month/day date string

DATE_DELIMITER.description: The value used to delimit individual dates in a date string passed to various Calendar functions.

LOCALE_MONTHS.description: The setting that determines which length of month labels should be used. Possible values are "short" and "long".

iframe.description: Whether or not an iframe shim should be placed under the Calendar to prevent select boxes from bleeding through in Internet Explorer 6 and below.

WEEKDAYS_1CHAR.description: The 1-character weekday labels for the current locale.

WEEKDAYS_SHORT.description: The short weekday labels for the current locale.

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the table element that will represent the calendar widget

params.name: containerId
params.description: The id of the container div element that will wrap the calendar table

params.name: config
params.description: The configuration object containing the Calendar's arguments

constructors.description: YAHOO.widget.CalendarGroup is a special container class for YAHOO.widget.Calendar. This class facilitates the ability to have multi-page calendar views that share a single dataset and are dependent on each other. The calendar group instance will refer to each of its elements using a 0-based index. For example, to construct the placeholder for a calendar group widget with id "cal1" and containerId of "cal1Container", the markup would be as follows: <div id="cal1Container_0"></div> <div id="cal1Container_1"></div> The tables for the calendars ("cal1_0" and "cal1_1") will be inserted into those containers.

beforeDeselectEvent.description: Fired before a selection is made

beforeRenderEvent.description: Fired before the Calendar is rendered

beforeSelectEvent.description: Fired before a selection is made

renderEvent.description: Fired when the Calendar is rendered

changePageEvent.description: Fired when the Calendar page is changed

resetEvent.description: Fired when the Calendar is reset

clearEvent.description: Fired when the Calendar is cleared

params.name: Array
params.description: of Date field arrays in the format [YYYY, MM, DD].

selectEvent.description: Fired when a selection is made

params.name: Array
params.description: of Date field arrays in the format [YYYY, MM, DD].

deselectEvent.description: Fired when a selection is made

return.description: Array of JavaScript Date objects representing all individual dates that are currently selected.

params.name: cellIndex
params.description: The index of the cell to deselect in the current calendar.

deselectCell.description:
Deselects a date on the current calendar by referencing the index of the cell that should be deselected.
This method is used to easily deselect a single cell (usually with a mouse click) without having to do
a full render. The selected style is removed from the cell directly.

params.name: weekday
params.description: The weekday (0-6) to associate with this renderer

params.name: fnRender
params.description: The function executed to render cells that match the render rules for this renderer.

addWeekdayRenderer.description:
Adds a weekday to the render stack. The function reference passed to this method will be executed
when a date cell matches the weekday passed to this method.

render.description: Calls the render function of all child calendars within the group.

nextYear.description: Navigates to the next year in the currently selected month in the calendar widget.

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args
params.description: The CustomEvent arguments. For configuration handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value for the property.

params.name: obj
params.description: The scope object. For configuration handlers, this will usually equal the owner.

delegateConfig.description: Delegates a configuration property to the CustomEvents associated with the CalendarGroup's children

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args
params.description: The CustomEvent arguments. For configuration handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value for the property.

params.name: obj
params.description: The scope object. For configuration handlers, this will usually equal the owner.

configPages.description: The default Config handler for the "pages" property

params.name: count
params.description: The number of years to subtract from the current calendar

subtractYears.description:
Subtcats the designated number of years from the current calendar, and sets the current
calendar page date to the new month.

previousMonth.description: Navigates to the previous month page in the calendar widget.

return.description: Array of JavaScript Date objects representing all individual dates that are currently selected.

params.name: date
params.description:
The date string of dates to select in the current calendar. Valid formats are
individual date(s) (12/24/2005,12/26/2005) or date range(s) (12/24/2005-1/1/2006).
Multiple comma-delimited dates can also be passed to this method (12/24/2005,12/11/2005-12/13/2005).
This method can also take a JavaScript Date object or an array of Date objects.

select.description:
Selects a date or a collection of dates on the current calendar. This method, by default,
does not call the render method explicitly. Once selection has completed, render must be 
called for the changes to be reflected visually.

params.name: fnName
params.description: The name of the function

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments to pass to the function

callChildFunction.description: Calls a function within all child Calendars within this CalendarGroup.

return.description: Array of JavaScript Date objects representing all individual dates that are currently selected.

params.name: date
params.description:
The date string of dates to deselect in the current calendar. Valid formats are
individual date(s) (12/24/2005,12/26/2005) or date range(s) (12/24/2005-1/1/2006).
Multiple comma-delimited dates can also be passed to this method (12/24/2005,12/11/2005-12/13/2005).
This method can also take a JavaScript Date object or an array of Date objects.

deselect.description:
Deselects a date or a collection of dates on the current calendar. This method, by default,
does not call the render method explicitly. Once deselection has completed, render must be 
called for the changes to be reflected visually.

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to subscribe to this CustomEvent

params.name: obj
params.description: The CustomEvent's scope object

params.name: bOverride
params.description: Whether or not to apply scope correction

sub.description: Proxy subscriber to subscribe to the CalendarGroup's child Calendars' CustomEvents

previousYear.description: Navigates to the previous year in the currently selected month in the calendar widget.

nextMonth.description: Navigates to the next month page in the calendar widget.

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args
params.description: The CustomEvent arguments. For configuration handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value for the property.

params.name: obj
params.description: The scope object. For configuration handlers, this will usually equal the owner.

configPageDate.description: The default Config handler for the "pagedate" property

params.name: fnName
params.description: The name of the function

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to apply to each Calendar page object

setChildFunction.description: Adds a function to all child Calendars within this CalendarGroup.

params.name: month
params.description: The month (1-12) to associate with this renderer

params.name: fnRender
params.description: The function executed to render cells that match the render rules for this renderer.

addMonthRenderer.description:
Adds a month to the render stack. The function reference passed to this method will be executed
when a date cell matches the month passed to this method.

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the table element that will represent the calendar widget

params.name: containerId
params.description: The id of the container div element that will wrap the calendar table

params.name: config
params.description: The configuration object containing the Calendar's arguments

init.description:
Initializes the calendar group. All subclasses must call this method in order for the
group to be initialized properly.

return.description: A string representation of the CalendarGroup object.

toString.description: Returns a string representation of the object.

return.description: Array of JavaScript Date objects representing all individual dates that are currently selected.

params.name: cellIndex
params.description: The index of the cell to select in the current calendar.

selectCell.description:
Selects a date on the current calendar by referencing the index of the cell that should be selected.
This method is used to easily select a single cell (usually with a mouse click) without having to do
a full render. The selected style is applied to the cell directly.

renderFooter.description:
Renders a footer for the 2-up calendar container. By default, this method is
unimplemented.

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to subscribe to this CustomEvent

params.name: obj
params.description: The CustomEvent's scope object

unsub.description: Proxy unsubscriber to unsubscribe from the CalendarGroup's child Calendars' CustomEvents

return.description: An array of currently selected JavaScript Date objects.

getSelectedDates.description: Gets the list of currently selected dates from the calendar.

params.name: sDates
params.description:
A date string to associate with the specified renderer. Valid formats
include date (12/24/2005), month/day (12/24), and range (12/1/2004-1/1/2005)

params.name: fnRender
params.description: The function executed to render cells that match the render rules for this renderer.

addRenderer.description:
Adds a renderer to the render stack. The function reference passed to this method will be executed
when a date cell matches the conditions specified in the date string for this renderer.

reset.description:
Resets the calendar widget to the originally selected month and year, and 
sets the calendar to the initial selection(s).

return.description:
Array of JavaScript Date objects representing all individual dates that are currently selected.
Assuming that this function executes properly, the return value should be an empty array.
However, the empty array is returned for the sake of being able to check the selection status
of the calendar.

deselectAll.description: Deselects all dates on the current calendar.

params.name: month
params.description: The numeric month, from 0 (January) to 11 (December)

setMonth.description:
Sets the calendar group's month explicitly. This month will be set into the first
page of the multi-page calendar, and all other months will be iterated appropriately.

clear.description:
Clears the selected dates in the current calendar widget and sets the calendar
to the current month and year.

params.name: count
params.description: The number of months to add to the current calendar

addMonths.description:
Adds the designated number of months to the current calendar month, and sets the current
calendar page date to the new month.

params.name: count
params.description: The number of months to subtract from the current calendar

subtractMonths.description:
Subtracts the designated number of months from the current calendar month, and sets the current
calendar page date to the new month.

return.description: The YAHOO.widget.Calendar instance that is constructed

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the table element that will represent the calendar widget

params.name: containerId
params.description: The id of the container div element that will wrap the calendar table

params.name: config
params.description: The configuration object containing the Calendar's arguments

constructChild.description:
Constructs a child calendar. This method can be overridden if a subclassed version of the default
calendar is to be used.

params.name: year
params.description: The numeric 4-digit year

setYear.description:
Sets the calendar group's year explicitly. This year will be set into the first
page of the multi-page calendar, and all other months will be iterated appropriately.

renderHeader.description: Renders the header for the CalendarGroup.

params.name: count
params.description: The number of years to add to the current calendar

addYears.description:
Adds the designated number of years to the current calendar, and sets the current
calendar page date to the new month.

YAHOO.widget.CalendarGroup.description: YAHOO.widget.CalendarGroup is a special container class for YAHOO.widget.Calendar. This class facilitates the ability to have multi-page calendar views that share a single dataset and are dependent on each other. The calendar group instance will refer to each of its elements using a 0-based index. For example, to construct the placeholder for a calendar group widget with id "cal1" and containerId of "cal1Container", the markup would be as follows: <div id="cal1Container_0"></div> <div id="cal1Container_1"></div> The tables for the calendars ("cal1_0" and "cal1_1") will be inserted into those containers.

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the table element that will represent the calendar widget

params.name: containerId
params.description: The id of the container div element that will wrap the calendar table

params.name: config
params.description: The configuration object containing the Calendar's arguments

constructors.description:
Calendar is the base class for the Calendar widget. In its most basic implementation, it has the ability to render a calendar widget on the page that can be manipulated to select a single date, move back and forth between months and years.

To construct the placeholder for the calendar widget, the code is as follows:

<div id="cal1Container"></div> Note that the table can be replaced with any kind of element.

beforeRenderEvent.description: Fired before the Calendar is rendered

renderEvent.description: Fired when the Calendar is rendered

changePageEvent.description: Fired when the Calendar page is changed

resetEvent.description: Fired when the Calendar is reset

clearEvent.description: Fired when the Calendar is cleared

params.description: An array of date field arrays representing which date or dates were deselected. Example: [ [2006,8,6],[2006,8,7],[2006,8,8] ]

onDeselect.description: Event executed when a date is deselected in the calendar widget.

return.description: Array of JavaScript Date objects representing all individual dates that are currently selected.

deselectCell.description:
Deselects a date on the current calendar by referencing the index of the cell that should be deselected.
This method is used to easily deselect a single cell (usually with a mouse click) without having to do
a full render. The selected style is removed from the cell directly.

params.description: The function executed to render cells that match the render rules for this renderer.

addWeekdayRenderer.description:
Adds a weekday to the render stack. The function reference passed to this method will be executed
when a date cell matches the weekday passed to this method.

render.description:
Renders the calendar after it has been configured. The render() method has a specific call chain that will execute
when the method is called: renderHeader, renderBody, renderFooter.
Refer to the documentation for those methods for information on 
individual render tasks.

return.description:
YAHOO.widget.Calendar.STOP_RENDER if rendering should stop with this style, null or nothing if rendering
should not be terminated

params.description: The current working Date object being used to generate the calendar

params.description: The current working cell in the calendar

renderCellStyleSelected.description: Applies the default style used for rendering selected dates to the current calendar cell

nextYear.description: Navigates to the next year in the currently selected month in the calendar widget.

configLocale.description: The default handler for all configuration locale properties

return.description: Array of date field arrays

_toFieldArray.description:
Converts a date (either a JavaScript Date object, or a date string) to the internal data structure
used to represent dates: [[yyyy,mm,dd],[yyyy,mm,dd]].

params.name: date
params.description:
The date string of dates to deselect in the current calendar. Valid formats are
individual date(s) (12/24/2005,12/26/2005) or date range(s) (12/24/2005-1/1/2006).
Multiple comma-delimited dates can also be passed to this method (12/24/2005,12/11/2005-12/13/2005).
This method can also take a JavaScript Date object or an array of Date objects.

Adds the designated number of months to the current calendar month, and sets the current
calendar page date to the new month.

Subtcats the designated number of years from the current calendar, and sets the current
calendar page date to the new month.

to the current month and year.

Builds the date label that will be displayed in the calendar header or
footer, depending on configuration.

renderCellDefault.description:
Renders a single standard calendar cell in the calendar widget table.
All logic for determining how a standard default cell will be rendered is 
encapsulated in this method, and must be accounted for when extending the
widget class.

return.description: JavaScript Date object representing the date field array

_toDate.description: Converts a date field array [yyyy,mm,dd] to a JavaScript Date object.

params.name: dateFieldArray
params.description: The date field array to convert to a JavaScript Date.

return.description: An array of currently selected JavaScript Date objects.

getSelectedDates.description: Gets the list of currently selected dates from the calendar.

return.description: The formatted day label

params.name: workingDate
params.description: The current working date

buildDayLabel.description: Builds the date digit that will be displayed in calendar cells

return.description: Array of JavaScript Date objects representing all individual dates that are currently selected.

params.name: date
params.description:
The date string of dates to select in the current calendar. Valid formats are
individual date(s) (12/24/2005,12/26/2005) or date range(s) (12/24/2005-1/1/2006).
Multiple comma-delimited dates can also be passed to this method (12/24/2005,12/11/2005-12/13/2005).
This method can also take a JavaScript Date object or an array of Date objects.

select.description:
Selects a date or a collection of dates on the current calendar. This method, by default,
does not call the render method explicitly. Once selection has completed, render must be 
called for the changes to be reflected visually.

return.description:
YAHOO.widget.Calendar.STOP_RENDER if rendering should stop with this style, null or nothing if rendering
should not be terminated

params.name: workingDate
params.description: The current working Date object being used to generate the calendar

params.name: cell
params.description: The current working cell in the calendar

renderOutOfBoundsDate.description:
Renders a cell that falls before the minimum date or after the maximum date.
widget class.

refreshLocale.description: Refreshes the locale values used to build the Calendar.

return.description:
The index of the date field array within the collection of selected dates.
-1 will be returned if the date is not found.

_indexOfSelectedFieldArray.description: Gets the index of a date field array [yyyy,mm,dd] in the current list of selected dates.

params.name: find
params.description: The date field array to search for

onClear.deprecated: Event handlers for this event should be susbcribed to clearEvent.
onClear.description: Event executed when the calendar widget is completely cleared to the current month with no selections.

previousYear.description: Navigates to the previous year in the currently selected month in the calendar widget.

nextMonth.description: Navigates to the next month page in the calendar widget.

onReset.deprecated: Event handlers for this event should be susbcribed to resetEvemt.
onReset.description: Event executed when the calendar widget is reset to its original state.

configPageDate.description: The default handler for the "pagedate" property

return.description: The current working HTML array

params.name: workingDate
params.description: The current working Date being used for the render process

params.description: The current working HTML array

configOptions.description: The default handler for all configuration options properties

params.name: The
params.description: CSS class name to remove from all calendar body cells

clearAllBodyCellStyles.description: Removes all styles from all body cells in the current calendar table.

return.description: An array of date field arrays

_parseRange.description: Converts a date range to the full list of included dates

params.name: startDate
params.description: Date field array representing the first date in the range

params.description: Date field array representing the last date in the range

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the table element that will represent the calendar widget

params.description: The id of the container div element that will wrap the calendar table

params.name: config
params.description: The configuration object containing the Calendar's arguments

onBeforeDeselect.description: Event executed before a date is deselected in the calendar widget.

return.description: A string representation of the Calendar object.

toString.description: Returns a string representation of the object.

resetRenderers.description: Resets the render stack of the current calendar to its original pre-render value.

return.description: true if the date is OOM

params.name: date
params.description: The JavaScript Date object for which to check the OOM status

isDateOOM.description: Determines whether a given date is OOM (out of month).

params.name: id

getDateFieldsByCellId.description: Retrieves the Date object for the specified Calendar cell

params.name: sDates
params.description:
A date string to associate with the specified renderer. Valid formats
include date (12/24/2005), month/day (12/24), and range (12/1/2004-1/1/2005)

params.name: fnRender
params.description: The function executed to render cells that match the render rules for this renderer.

addRenderer.description:
Adds a renderer to the render stack. The function reference passed to this method will be executed
when a date cell matches the conditions specified in the date string for this renderer.

return.description:
YAHOO.widget.Calendar.STOP_RENDER if rendering should stop with this style, null or nothing if rendering
should not be terminated

params.description: The current working Date object being used to generate the calendar

params.name: cell
params.description: The current working cell in the calendar

renderCellNotThisMonth.description:
Applies the default style used for rendering dates that are not a part of the current
month (preceding or trailing the cells for the current month)

params.name: e
params.description: The event

params.name: cal
params.description: A reference to the calendar passed by the Event utility

doSelectCell.description:
The default event function that is attached to a date link within a calendar cell
when the calendar is rendered.

configLocaleValues.description: The default handler for all configuration locale field length properties

onBeforeSelect.deprecated: Event handlers for this event should be susbcribed to beforeSelectEvent.
onBeforeSelect.description: Event executed before a date is selected in the calendar widget.

renderRowHeader.description: Renders the row header for a week.

return.description: Array of JavaScript Date objects representing all individual dates that are currently selected.

params.name: cellIndex
params.description: The index of the cell to select in the current calendar.

selectCell.description:
Selects a date on the current calendar by referencing the index of the cell that should be selected.
This method is used to easily select a single cell (usually with a mouse click) without having to do
a full render. The selected style is applied to the cell directly.

return.description: Array of JavaScript Date objects representing all individual dates that are currently selected.

params.name: date
params.description:
The date string of dates to deselect in the current calendar. Valid formats are
individual date(s) (12/24/2005,12/26/2005) or date range(s) (12/24/2005-1/1/2006).
Multiple comma-delimited dates can also be passed to this method (12/24/2005,12/11/2005-12/13/2005).
This method can also take a JavaScript Date object or an array of Date objects.

deselect.description:
Deselects a date or a collection of dates on the current calendar. This method, by default,
does not call the render method explicitly. Once deselection has completed, render must be 
called for the changes to be reflected visually.

return.description: An array of date field arrays

_parseDates.description: Converts a multi or single-date string to an array of date field arrays

params.name: sDates
params.description: Date string with one or more comma-delimited dates. Valid formats are mm/dd, mm/dd/yyyy, mm/dd/yyyy-mm/dd/yyyy

applyListeners.description: Applies the Calendar's DOM listeners to applicable elements.

return.description:
Should return true if the widget validates, and false if
it doesn't.

validate.description:
Validates the calendar widget. This method has no default implementation
and must be extended by subclassing the widget.

return.description: The current working HTML array

params.name: html
params.description: The current working HTML array

renderFooter.description:
Renders the calendar footer. In the default implementation, there is
no footer.

configMaxDate.description: The default handler for the "maxdate" property

configSelected.description: The default handler for the "selected" property

params.name: type
params.description:
The type string that indicates the type of date renderer being added.
Values are YAHOO.widget.Calendar.DATE, YAHOO.widget.Calendar.MONTH_DAY, YAHOO.widget.Calendar.WEEKDAY,
YAHOO.widget.Calendar.RANGE, YAHOO.widget.Calendar.MONTH

params.name: aDates
params.description:
An array of dates used to construct the renderer. The format varies based
on the renderer type

params.name: fnRender
params.description: The function executed to render cells that match the render rules for this renderer.

_addRenderer.description:
The private method used for adding cell renderers to the local render stack.
This method is called by other methods that set the renderer type prior to the method call.

reset.description:
Resets the calendar widget to the originally selected month and year, and 
sets the calendar to the initial selection(s).

return.description:
Array of JavaScript Date objects representing all individual dates that are currently selected.
Assuming that this function executes properly, the return value should be an empty array.
However, the empty array is returned for the sake of being able to check the selection status
of the calendar.

Style.description: Collection of Style constants for the Calendar

YAHOO.widget.Calendar.WEEKDAY.description: Type constant used for renderers to represent a weekday

cfg.description: The Config object used to hold the configuration variables for the Calendar

YAHOO.widget.Calendar.MONTH_DAY.description: Type constant used for renderers to represent an individual date across any year (M/D)

YAHOO.widget.Calendar.IMG_ROOT.description: The path to be used for images loaded for the Calendar

Config.description: The configuration object used to set up the calendars various locale and style options.
Config.deprecated: Configuration properties should be set by calling Calendar.cfg.setProperty.

id.description: The id that uniquely identifies this calendar. This id should match the id of the placeholder element on the page.

index.description: The index of this item in the parent group

YAHOO.widget.Calendar.STOP_RENDER.description: Constant used for halting the execution of the remainder of the render stack

YAHOO.widget.Calendar.MONTH.description: Type constant used for renderers to represent a month across any year

renderStack.description: The list of render functions, along with required parameters, used to render cells.

_renderStack.description: A copy of the initial render functions created before rendering.

today.description: A Date object representing today's date.

_selectedDates.description: The private list of initially selected dates.

parent.description: The parent CalendarGroup, only to be set explicitly by the parent group

oDomContainer.description: The DOM element reference that points to this calendar's container element. The calendar will be inserted into this element when the shell is rendered.

YAHOO.widget.Calendar.RANGE.description: Type constant used for renderers to represent a range of individual dates (M/D/Y-M/D/Y)

Options.description: The local object which contains the Calendar's options

cellDates.description: The collection of calendar cell dates that is parallel to the cells collection. The array contains dates field arrays in the format of [YYYY, M, D].

Locale.description: The local object which contains the Calendar's locale settings

cells.description: The collection of calendar table cells

YAHOO.widget.Calendar.DATE.description: Type constant used for renderers to represent an individual date (M/D/Y)

domEventMap.description: A map of DOM event handlers to attach to cells associated with specific CSS class names

YAHOO.widget.Calendar.DISPLAY_DAYS.description: Constant that represents the total number of date cells that are displayed in a given month

_pageDate.description: A Date object representing the month/year that the calendar is initially set to

browser.description: Returns a string representing the current browser.

YAHOO.widget.Calendar.description:
Calendar is the base class for the Calendar widget. In its most basic implementation, it has the ability to render a calendar widget on the page that can be manipulated to select a single date, move back and forth between months and years.

To construct the placeholder for the calendar widget, the code is as follows:

<div id="cal1Container"></div> Note that the table can be replaced with any kind of element.

calendar.name: calendar
calendar.title: Calendar
calendar.description: The Calendar component is a UI control that enables users to choose one or more dates from a graphical calendar presented in a one-month ("one-up") or two-month ("two-up") interface. Calendars are generated entirely via script and can be navigated without any page refreshes.
